dest.title: Alaska
dest.desc: Full of wildlife, nature, and breathtaking scenery, you can go on adventures in locations such as Glacier Bay National Park, Kenai Fjords National Park, and Prince William Sound.

dest.title: Antigua
dest.desc: Sail the Caribbean and visit the pristine, private beaches.

dest.title: Australia
dest.desc: Explore the Great Barrier Reef, or cruise the Outback, Gold Coast, Perth, and Sydney Harbour.

dest.title: Bahamas
dest.desc: Relax on the secluded, white-sand beaches or go SCUBA diving and snorkeling in the crystal clear tropical waters.

dest.title: Balearic Islands
dest.desc: Located off the coast of Spain in the dazzling Mediterranean Sea, you can party at the nightclubs in Ibiza or travel the hidden coves and magnificent coastline of Mallorca.

dest.title: Bar Harbor (Maine)
dest.desc: Visit Acadia National Park.

dest.title: Belize
dest.desc: This small country in Central America, with its barrier reef, caves, and Mayan ruins, is known for it world-class snorkeling and scuba diving.

dest.title: Bermuda
dest.desc: One of the most beautiful islands in the world, with 181 islets you can explore. Relax on the pink sand beaches, or explore the underwater caves and shipwrecks.

dest.title: Bora Bora
dest.desc: This remote, romantic island is great for honeymoons and wedding anniversaries.

dest.title: Boracay (Philippines)
dest.desc: Go scuba diving to see the beautiful coral reefs and shipwrecks.

dest.title: Borneo (Malaysia)
dest.desc: This former British colony is part of Malaysian and Indonesia, located near Manilla, Singapore, and Hong Kong. Cruise among the various islands and explore the tropical rainforest.

dest.title: Boston
dest.desc: Tour Boston Harbor, Martha's Vineyard, Nantucket, Newport, Maine, Cape Cod, and more.

dest.title: British Virgin Islands
dest.desc: Comprised of 60 islands perfect for sailing, fishing, diving, and relaxing.

dest.title: Canary Islands (Africa)
dest.desc: This area west of Morocco, with lush forests and mountains, is popular with more experienced sailors.

dest.title: Cannes
dest.desc: Vacation with celebrities and superyachts on the French Riviera.

dest.title: Catalina Island (California)
dest.desc: Some call it the “Hawaii of Southern California”.

dest.title: Chesapeake Bay
dest.desc: Go tubing, wakeboarding, or water skiing in the largest estuary in the United-States (around 200 miles long).

dest.title: China
dest.desc: See the festivals and ancient religious sites in areas such as Shanghai and Shenzhen.

dest.title: Cooper Island (British Virgin Islands)
dest.desc: Visit the Cooper Island Beach Club, which is a luxury eco-resort located on the beach, and snorkel or scuba dive to see the stunning coral reef filled with marine life.

dest.title: Copenhagen (Denmark)
dest.desc: Sail down the canals of this old maritime city.

dest.title: Corfu (Greece)
dest.desc: This Greek island, with its warm clear water, is great for sailing.

dest.title: Corsica
dest.desc: A Mediterranean island in Southern France, with coastal towns, beaches, and hiking trails.

dest.title: Costa Rica
dest.desc: Known for its jungles, wildlife, and natural beauty, the moderate climate and tranquil waters make Costa Rica perfect for yachting.

dest.title: Costa Smeralda
dest.desc: Explore the coast of Sardinia (Italy) on a luxury yacht. Enjoy diving, sailing, dolphins, and nightlife

dest.title: Crete (Greece)
dest.desc: Travel back in time and explore the ancient sites and traditions of this largest of the Greek islands.

dest.title: Croatia
dest.desc: A rugged, Mediterranean country on the Adriatic Sea, known for its nightlife, cuisine, and ancient villages.

dest.title: Cuba
dest.desc: Great scenery, rum, cigars, and diving in the Caribbean.

dest.title: Dominica
dest.desc: A Caribbean island in the Eastern Caribbean, near Martinique and Guadeloupe . Often confused with the Dominican Republic, this is a totally different vacation spot.

dest.title: Dubai
dest.desc: Activities include fun watersports, four wheeling in the dunes, shopping at the luxury malls, and dining at five-star restaurants.

dest.title: Fiji
dest.desc: Made up of over 300 islands in the South Pacific, it is famous for its tropical beaches and clear lagoons.

dest.title: Florida
dest.desc: With charter destinations such as Miami and the Florida Keys, there are endless vacation possibilities.

dest.title: France
dest.desc: Vacation in luxury on the French Riviera. Shop at the chic boutiques or gamble at the elegant casinos.

dest.title: French Riviera
dest.desc: The premier boating playground of the rich and famous, it hosts more superyachts than anywhere in the world. Destinations include Monaco, Cannes, Saint Tropez, Antibes, Nice, and Monte Carlo.

dest.title: French West Indies
dest.desc: From Guadeloupe to Martinique, take in the natural beauty of the rainforests, waterfalls, lagoons, and sandy beaches.

dest.title: Galapagos Islands
dest.desc: This remote Pacific island is the premier destination for viewing unique wildlife, and was the inspiration for Charles Darwin's theory of evolution when he traveled there in 1835.

dest.title: Greece
dest.desc: One of the most popular yachting destinations in the world, with over 2,000 islands to explore.

dest.title: Grenada
dest.desc: Known as the 'Spice Isle', this Caribbean island grows more spices per square mile than anywhere else in the world.

dest.title: Ibiza
dest.desc: Party in the nightclubs on this Balearic Island off the coast of Spain, or cruise the warm waters of the Mediterranean.

dest.title: Iceland
dest.desc: Sail to the quaint fishing villages and snow capped glaciers, or visit remote areas full of beautiful scenery, fjords, and wildlife.

dest.title: Indonesia
dest.desc: Home to over 17,000 islands with jungles, rainforests, beauty, and adventure.

dest.title: Ionian Islands (Greece)
dest.desc: With lush landscapes, and exciting nightlife, and Italian influence, the 7 main islands (Corfu is the most famous) are a popular tourist spot.

dest.title: Ireland
dest.desc: Known as the “Emerald Isle” thanks to its luscious green landscapes and rolling hills.

dest.title: Italian Coast
dest.desc: Tour scenic locations such as Portofino, Cinque Terre, Ligurian Riviera, and Santa Margherita.

dest.title: Japan
dest.desc: 7,000 islands full of astounding scenery and delectable local cuisines. Scuba dive for black pearls, visit an active volcano, or find peace in a Japanese garden.

dest.title: Lelepa
dest.desc: A small island in the South Pacific nation of Vanuatu.

dest.title: Italy
dest.desc: Enjoy the food and local culture of cities such as Sicily, Rome, Capri, Venice, and Sardinia.

dest.title: Madagascar (Africa)
dest.desc: The protected waters are perfect for scuba diving and snorkeling. Or visit the national parks and reserves.

dest.title: Maine
dest.desc: Take in the views of the rocky coastline while dining on fresh lobsters, shrimp, and clams.

dest.title: Malaysia
dest.desc: Explore the lush rainforests and jungles as you sail in the Pacific Ocean.

dest.title: Maldives
dest.desc: Located in the Indian Ocean, dive and see over than 2000 different fish species or navigate the 1100 islands and atolls.

dest.title: Malta
dest.desc: Sail the sparkling waters and visit the many historical sites on this Mediterranean island.

dest.title: Martinique
dest.desc: An island full of French culture, rainforests, mountains , and beaches.

dest.title: Maui (Hawaii)
dest.desc: Relax in paradise and enjoy the snorkeling, surfing, and windsurfing.

dest.title: Mauritius
dest.desc: This East African island nation is known for its beaches, lagoons and reefs. You can also visiit the rainforests, waterfalls, hiking trails and wildlife of Black River Gorges National Park.

dest.title: Miami
dest.desc: Enjoy a beautiful sunset cruise on Biscayne Bay, or venture to the Florida Keys, the Bahamas, or Bimini.

dest.title: Milos (Greece)
dest.desc: See the rock formations, caves, and villages of this Greek volcanic island.

dest.title: Monaco
dest.desc: Glamorous, elite, and luxurious with a hedonistic nightlife of parties and casinos.

dest.title: Mumbai (India)
dest.desc: View the beautiful skyline, or fish in the open waters.

dest.title: Nantucket
dest.desc: 30 miles south of Cape Code, this island has a whaling museum, historic homes, a lighthouse, bike tours, beaches, and more.

dest.title: New Caledonia
dest.desc: The tropical islands of this French territory in the South Pacific are filled with flora, fauna and marine life.

dest.title: New England
dest.desc: Go whale watching in Cape Cod, cruise the rocky coast of Maine, venture to Martha's Vineyard and Nantucket, and enjoy the wonderful food and wine of Newport.

dest.title: New Zealand
dest.desc: Known for its beautiful forests and mountains, it is also home to seals, penguins, dolphins, whales and exotic birds.

dest.title: Newport (Rhode Island)
dest.desc: Home of the world's most famous sailing race (America's Cup). Enjoy the historic lighthouses in Narragansett Bay, or visit nearby Jamestown, Block Island, Martha's Vineyard, Nantucket, and Cape Cod.

dest.title: Norway
dest.desc: View the Northern Lights from your private yacht or take in the dramatic fjords, glaciers, mountains, and waterfalls of this picturesque country.

dest.title: Panama Canal
dest.desc: A unique opportunity to cruise from one ocean to another.

dest.title: Qatar
dest.desc: Enjoy the year-round sunshine and sandy beaches of this modern Middle Eastern country.

dest.title: Red Sea
dest.desc: Visit North Africa, famous for its world-class diving, coral reefs, and Egyptian wonders.

dest.title: Rhodes
dest.desc: Stroll through the historic town center of this island on the Aegean Sea and visit the medieval castle. Also known for its surfing and butterflies.

dest.title: Ross Sea (Antartica)
dest.desc: A voyage of exploration full of whales, penguins, climbing, and fishing.

dest.title: Saint Martin
dest.desc: Part of the Leeward Islands, near Puerto Rico, this is one of the most popular sailing destinations in the Caribbean.

dest.title: San Francisco
dest.desc: Go sailing in San Francisco Bay or visit the infamous Alcatraz prison.

dest.title: Santorini
dest.desc: A Greek island of romance on the Aegean Sea. The steep cliffs that surround the island provide beautiful views and picturesque sunsets.

dest.title: Sardinia (Italy)
dest.desc: Located off the coast of Italy, you can explore miles of coastline filled with sandy beaches.

dest.title: Scotland
dest.desc: Rich is heritage and culture, it is a land filled with castles, seaside towns, fishing villages, distilleries, and local pubs.

dest.title: Seattle
dest.desc: Cruise the islands of the Pacific Northwest.

dest.title: Seychelles
dest.desc: Made up of 115 tropical islands in the Indian Ocean, on the Eastern side of Africa.

dest.title: Sicily
dest.desc: A popular sailing area, this unique volcanic island is filled with natural beauty and Italian historical culture.

dest.title: Singapore
dest.desc: Potential destinations include the exclusive Lazarus Island, which can only be accessed by private yacht.

dest.title: Sri Lanka
dest.desc: Go sport fishing on the Indian Ocean or explore the lush rainforests and ancient cities on the interior of the island.

dest.title: St. Barts
dest.desc: Home to sailing regattas and superyachts, and a favorite vacation spot of the Kardashians.

dest.title: Tahiti
dest.desc: Snorkel and scuba in this tropical paradise with barrier reefs full of dolphins, sea turtles, sharks, and colorful fish.

dest.title: Thailand
dest.desc: Tropical islands full of vibrant colors, lagoons, and exotic adventures, with pristine water perfect for diving, snorkeling, sailing and kayaking.

dest.title: The Cook Islands
dest.desc: A South Pacific paradise with white sand beaches, located between Tahiti and Tonga.

dest.title: Tonga
dest.desc: Hop among the uninhabited South Pacific islands or stop at the Tongan villages to experience the feasts and island culture.

dest.title: Turkey
dest.desc: Enjoy the ancient history and culture.

dest.title: Turquoise Coast (Turkey)
dest.desc: Experience the culture of Turkey, ancient ruins, and delicious and local cuisines.

dest.title: US Virgin Islands
dest.desc: Year-round warm temperatures make for spectacular sailing in St. Thomas, St. Croix, and St. John.

dest.title: Vancouver
dest.desc: Venture into the Salish Sea to visit fjords, mountains, and wildlife. Or look for seals, whales and dolphins in Vancouver Harbour.

dest.title: Whitsunday Islands (Australia)
dest.desc: Explore Queensland's secluded bays and pristine beaches, and snorkel in the coral reefs.

dest.title: Windward Islands
dest.desc: Tour Saint Lucia, Grenada, Barbados, Martinique, St. Vincent, and The Grenadines.
